programme.desc: David Coffin's house burned down with him in it, but it wasn't the fire that killed him, it was the bullet in his head; investigators immediately focused on Scott Davis, the estranged husband of Coffin's new girlfriend.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 1
programme.desc: The first of three festive Poker After Dark nights headlined by Phil Hellmuth featured jolly $10000 Sit & Go! Rewatch the full show as Hellmuth took on Maria Ho Antonio Esfandiari Mike Matusow Dan Shak and Randall Emmett.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 2
programme.desc: The festivities continue on Holidays with Hellmuth as Phil takes on all comers in this $100/$200 cash game. Rewatch the whole show now as he goes up against Dan Shak Brian Potashnik David 'Doc' Sands Avi Freedman and Rick Thompson.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Take an intimate look at one table as it develops over a week of play. The world's best players come together to play a single-table tournament or cash game as your favorite players look to beat the best on Poker After Dark.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Day 1A of the 2004 WSOP Main Event is underway with Daniel Negreanu, Men "The Master" Nguyen, and John Hennigan on the feature table. Defending champion Chris Moneymaker kicks off his title defense, while several big names find themselves heading home early.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Coverage continues on Day 1B of the WSOP Main Event, and last year's runner-up Sammy Farha headlines the feature table along with John Juanda. Chris Ferguson and "Miami" John Cernuto then join the feature table action, as many poker pros hit the rail on Day 1B.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Day 2 action in the WSOP Main Event sees Doyle Brunson headline the feature table along with Scott Fischman. Siblings Howard Lederer and Annie Duke are eliminated, along with two previous Main Event champions.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Money day has arrived in the WSOP Main Event with just 277 players remaining on Day 3. Gus Hansen takes center stage on the feature table, and is joined by Daniel Alaei and Dan Harrington while two other previous champions also survive the day.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 149 players remain in the 2004 WSOP Main Event, and Mike Matusow headlines the feature table alongside Greg "Fossilman" Raymer and John Esposito. However, it would be John Murphy, Josh Arieh, and Marcel Luske climbing to the top of the leaderboard.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: World Champions Dan Harrington and Chris Ferguson headline the feature table on Day 5 of the WSOP Main Event. The only other former champion wouldn't survive, as Doyle Brunson was eliminated.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 3
programme.desc: The final night of Holidays with Hellmuth brought out a festive lineup and some great poker action! Poker legends Phil Hellmuth Daniel Negreanu and Doyle Brunson were joined by Maria Ho and first-timers Dave Penski and Joe Marchese with $150000 at st

programme.desc: The Event #1: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Jeremy Ausmus is the chip leader ahead of Erik Seidel, Jacky Wang, Nick Schulman, Cole Ferraro, Anthony Hu, and Cary Katz, as the final seven players play for the $204,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #2: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Michael Brinkenhoff is the chip leader ahead of Ethan Yau, Alex Foxen, Stephen Song, Masashi Oya, and Dylan DeStefano, as the final six players play for the $197,600 first-place prize.

programme.title: Meli
programme.desc: Forced to take desperate measures to save her family, a young woman robs a stranger's home, unknowingly targeting someone far more dangerous.

programme.title: Murder Gardens 2
programme.desc: After serving ten years in prison, Chase returns to Miami Gardens with a goal of reclaiming his life. But the criminal empire that he was once part of has changed and his older brother Rell is now one of the heads. He recruits Chase for one last job.

programme.title: A Mother's Adoration
programme.desc: Letricia is a single mother raising her son Jared after his father was killed 17 years earlier. When his uncle comes back into his life, he seeks to cash in on Jared's athletic talent. Letricia must fight to keep her son on the right path.

programme.title: My Husband's Mistress
programme.desc: Behind the glamorous facade of the aviation industry, a dirty betrayal unfolds. A devoted wife's world is shattered when she discovers her husband's affair with her best friend. As the truth unravels, a battle for love, revenge, and survival ensues.

programme.title: Stick Em Game
programme.desc: Struggling to launch her social media career, Elise decides to switch to viral pranks. When one prank on an old acquaintance goes terribly wrong, a local gang leader is out for revenge. With her best friend's help, Elise must fight to survive.

programme.title: The Last Days of an Escort
programme.desc: Kitty, a struggling escort, agrees to be documented for a film. Her roommate, Star, a more successful escort, reluctantly joins. A new client, Earl, changes their lives forever when he asks to see Kitty and Star together. Kitty's world becomes increasingly dangerous as she navigates the dark underworld of escorting.

programme.title: Aliens in the Hood
programme.desc: The hood politics of the neighborhood become even more complicated after the arrival of aliens. When one man in the neighborhood is blessed with superpowers, he and the other warring factions are headed to war over control of the current drug trade.

programme.title: Ebony's Christmas Carol
programme.desc: A bitter winery owner is visited by three spirits who urge her to face the past and rediscover the joy she’s lost around the Christmas season.

programme.title: Runway of Shadows
programme.desc: Sisters Ivy and Zara are separated at a very young age due to their father's deceit. When Ivy and Zara unexpectedly cross paths at a prestigious runway show, the stage it set for a series of mysterious and unsettling events.

programme.title: Troublesome
programme.desc: A veteran detective and his rookie partner investigate a homicide case involving a vengeful kingpin who unleashes bloodshed across the city.

programme.title: Priceless: The Score
programme.desc: After starting their new record label, Donica Blair and Shequell Harris have entered a dangerous arena full of guns, lies, and deceit. Now they are racing against time to right their wrongs and save their own lives before they are next in a string of murders. Meanwhile their partner Seven, has fallen victim to the deadliest of them all; the Black widow.

programme.title: Merry Little Baby
programme.desc: When a baby pact with her best friend falls through, Shanice turns to a donor app in a last-ditch effort to have a baby by Christmas-which is also her 35th birthday. But what starts as a modern solution quickly spirals into holiday chaos, unexpected romance, and a reminder that love can't always be planned.

programme.title: The Laundry Room Stalker
programme.desc: A string of murders targeting local neighborhood sex workers centers around one apartment building's laundry room. Suspicion quickly falls on Calvin, the newly hired attendant who was just released after serving 12 years in prison. But this building holds a thousand secrets, and as tensions rise, the truth will unravel. Who is the real killer?

programme.title: A Matter of Heart
programme.desc: Balen, a successful family man, risks everything for a reckless affair. His wife, Krista, faces a harsh reality as her sacrifices are tested. Enter Latricia, a ruthless temptress with no shame. A story that weaves a tale of emotional turmoil, family crisis, unwavering faith, and the destructive power of temptation. Will love or lust prevail?

programme.title: The Lineup
programme.desc: Sebastian "Bas" Monte is an up-and-coming influencer and club promoter. He doesn't have the time to commit to only one woman, so he schedules out different women for his needs. That is until he meets Mikayla, and he questions his playboy ways.

programme.title: The Lying Truth
programme.desc: A rapper is accused of rape by a beautiful video vixen. He says he is innocent. One of them will be exposed as a liar when the truth is revealed.

programme.title: Guns Down
programme.desc: Summoned to an estate by a billionaire drug lord, a group of criminals find themselves caught in a deadly game, competing for a chance at freedom.

programme.title: Heavier
programme.desc: After a tragic night in the city, lovers, friends and family are forced to take on the dominating forces.

programme.title: Get Da Big Bag
programme.desc: A married woman who leads a double life learns the hard way that good things come to those who get the bag, but it comes with a steep price.

programme.title: Full Clip For a Snitch
programme.desc: Arrested drug dealers Malik and Chris set up another dealer, Deion, in exchange for their freedom. When Deion's mother finds out, she sets out on a mission to kill the people who snitched on her son.

programme.title: Flew'd Out
programme.desc: Tiara is a social media influencer who goes viral after posting a video of a fallout between her and a man she was dating. In an attempt to keep up her social media momentum, Tiara accepts an invitation to be flown out to meet a man named Josiah.

programme.title: A Thanksgiving Christmas

programme.title: A Holiday for Harmony

programme.title: Naughty or Nice
programme.desc: Melody, an exotic dancer, and her doctor boyfriend, Patrick, prepare to spend the holidays with Patrick's family. When they arrive, they are met by Patrick's overprotective judgmental mother, and she unleashes her wrath on Melody, as she's not good enough for her son.

programme.title: Missing you this Christmas

programme.desc: Assigned to guard the workers building Arizona's first telegraph line, Hoppy learns that a supposedly retired man who owns several stores will lose a fortune if the line is completed, and uses wiretapping to foil a sabotage scheme.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy uses a health tonic to prove the innocence of a convicted murderer and the guilt of the real killer.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: When Hoppy and Red try to conduct an honest election in outlaw territory, the outlaws retaliate by getting Hoppy's nephew into trouble.

programme.title: Montana
programme.desc: Aussie shepherd Morgan Lane (Errol Flynn) moves all the way to Montana in hopes of finding the perfect terrain for raising his sheep, but the local ranchers aren't keen on sharing their land with outsiders. Before long, Morgan clashes with powerful cattleman Rodney Ackroyd, and their rivalry is only intensified when Ackroyd's fiancée, Maria (Alexis Smith), has eyes for Morgan. However, her sympathies still lie with her lover, and it seems that only a gunfight can settle the conflict.

programme.title: The Quick and the Dead
programme.desc: In 1876 Wyoming, a mysterious stranger enters the lives of a homesteading couple after they are attacked by a ruthless gang.

programme.title: Tall Man Riding
programme.desc: A few years ago, Larry Madden (Randolph Scott) left his fiancée, Corinna (Dorothy Malone), after a run-in with her father, the wealthy land owner Tucker Ordway (Robert Barrat). After saving a man (William Ching) from a vicious attack, Larry learns hen is actually Corinna's new husband, and that some of the locals are preparing to challenge Tucker's land ownership. When Larry decides to ride back into town and make a claim himself, he encounters a few unexpected obstacles.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: After receiving a gunshot wound while running from Hollister's posse, a bank robber seeks medical attention and shelter.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: The townspeople are angry about escalating crime and criminals being set free by the court.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Cattle baron Oat Jackford orders his two cowboys to run Lucas McCain and his son off their ranch.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Mark gets caught on a mountain ledge, a young outlaw risks his life to rescue him and breaks his leg doing so.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The notorious Shelton rides into the town of North Fork to take revenge on an elderly Marshal who is now crippled and working for Lucas McCain.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Johnny Gibbs, Lucas McCain's brother-in-law, visits the McCain ranch. Gibbs, a rodeo rider wanted by the law, begins stirring up trouble.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Charged with cleaning up crime on the notorious Gallatin Street, Yancy finds himself against his best enemy, vice lord Toby Cook, owner of the Jumping Jack casino. However, Yancy hides an explosive trick up his sleeve - the tiny, noble sea captain of a ship crammed with the latest invention from Sweden. Backing up the unlikely duo is the silent, lethal Pahoo.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: When Yancy is asked to assist a U.S. Marshall in the river transport of $200,000 in Army payroll greenbacks, a charming young beauty by the name of Billie Jo James persuades Yancy to take her along up the river. When the ship is robbed, Yancy and Pahoo must protect the money, but it seems that the robbers have other plans.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: Bat encounters a group of wranglers who are stealing horses. A old flame of Bat's asks him to rescue her current beau, accused of murder and shackled to a tree by a lynch mob.

Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Spiders

programme.title: Charlie's Farm
programme.desc: Ignoring warnings, four friends head into the Australian outback to visit the site where a violent family met their end at the hands of an angry mob.

programme.title: Silent Night, Deadly Night Part 2
programme.desc: A mental patient tells his psychiatrist how he became a killer, after his brother died during their childhood, because of a certain Mother Superior.

programme.title: Hush
programme.desc: A deaf and mute writer living in the woods must fight for her life in silence when a terrifying masked killer appears at her window.

programme.title: The Stepfather
programme.desc: After murdering his entire family, a man remarries a widow with a teenage daughter in another town and prepares to do the same thing all over again.

programme.title: Stepfather II
programme.desc: After cheating death by surviving being both stabbed and shot, psychotic killer Jerry (Terry O'Quinn) is placed in a mental institution, but he soon murders his doctor and escapes. Taking on a dead man's identity, he moves to an upscale neighborhood in Los Angeles and sets his sights on local woman Carol (Meg Foster), slowly winning her heart. Carol's son, Todd (Jonathan Brandis), grows suspicious of his mom's new lover, however, and tensions reach the boiling point at the couple's wedding.

programme.title: Stepfather III: Father's Day
programme.desc: An escaped madman (Robert Wightman) romances a California divorcee; luckily her son knows how to use a computer.

programme.title: The Most Dangerous Game
programme.desc: When legendary hunter Bob Rainsford (Joel McCrea) is shipwrecked on the perilous reefs surrounding a mysterious island, he finds himself the guest of the reclusive and eccentric Count Zaroff (Leslie Banks). While he is very gracious at first, Zaroff eventually forces Rainsford and two other shipwreck survivors, brother and sister Eve (Fay Wray) and Martin Towbridge (Robert Armstrong), to participate in a sadistic game of cat and mouse in which they are the prey and he is the hunter.

programme.title: Deadcon
programme.desc: A group of young celebrities must unravel the mystery behind a vengeful spirit at the biggest digital event of the year, Viewcon.

programme.title: Sorority House Massacre
programme.desc: A college student and her sorority sisters are stalked by an escaped psychopathic killer who shares a strange bond of telepathy with her.

programme.title: Hammer House of Horror
programme.desc: A 17th-century witch uses her craft to transport herself to the 20th century. She brings spine-chilling terror to the present-day occupants of the old farmhouse in which she lived.

programme.title: Hammer House of Horror
programme.desc: Human sacrifice as part of an ancient rite is the unexpected consequence when an antiques dealer unwittingly buys a mirror with mysterious evil powers.

programme.title: Phantasm III: Lord of the Dead
programme.desc: The evil alien known as the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm) has infiltrated the minds of Mike (A. Michael Baldwin) and Reggie (Reggie Bannister). The two friends embark on a journey to find and kill him, only to discover that he has destroyed town after town, leaving zombies in place of the living. Along the way, Mike and Reggie meet several characters who share their goal, including a murderous boy named Tim (Kevin Connors) and two young women who are excellent fighters.

programme.title: Grizzly
programme.desc: A bloodthirsty grizzly bear stalks two estranged brothers (James Marsden, Thomas Jane) in the Alaskan wilderness.

programme.title: Donnie Darko (Director's Cut)
programme.desc: Sleepwalking, family drama, and strange visions of a doomsday-prophesying rabbit plague a troubled teenager in this mind-bending cult classic.

programme.title: The Nest

programme.title: Nightbreed
programme.desc: Aaron Boone (Craig Sheffer) is haunted by terrifying nightmares of a city of monsters. He goes to see a psychiatrist, Dr. Decker (David Cronenberg), for help. But what Boone doesn't know is that Decker is really a serial killer. Decker frames Boone to take the fall for his murders, and Boone is killed by the police. But Boone is brought back to life by the monsters of his dreams, the Nightbreed, who in turn join Boone in his quest to stop Decker from killing again.

programme.title: Piranha

programme.title: ALTER Files
programme.desc: A workplace horror anthology, featuring "Lunch Ladies," a Clarissa Jacobson Production Directed by J.M. Logan, "The Grey Matter" by- Peter McCoubrey and Luke McCoubrey, and "Together" by Ryan Oksenberg.

programme.title: Carnival of Souls

programme.title: Hammer House of Horror

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: After defeating Joey and taking third place in the tournament, Kaiba plans to destroy the Duel Tower and bury his past forever. Ishizu and Mokuba convince him otherwise, and he gives Yugi one all-powerful card that could give him a chance to defeat Marik in the final duel.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The final duel of Battle City begins. Yami Marik quickly turns it into a shadow game and sets it up so that if he or the Pharaoh loses, their host's soul will be destroyed. Yugi convinces the Pharaoh not to worry about him and to keep dueling to save Mai, Bakura and the good Marik. Yami Marik quickly discards his Winged Dragon of Ra to the graveyard, planning to revive it. Yugi manages to summon Slifer the Sky Dragon using his three Knights.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's
programme.desc: As the rematch between Kalin and Yusei continues, Yusei must find a way to out-think and out-maneuver the dark power of Kalin's Earthbound Immortal before it sends him to the Netherworld forever.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Odion tries to get the good Marik to resist his evil half. As a result, Yami Marik becomes angered, and attacks Odion with the Millennium Rod, which weakens Odion even more. Odion doesn't give up, despite Ishizu's protests. As Marik continues his onslaught (which begins to injure Odion), Odion tells Marik's good side that together, they had conquered his evil half before, and that they could do it again. Then, he tells the good Marik that since Yami Marik was created by the good Marik's hatred, he has the power to destroy him. As Yami Marik raises the Rod to deliver the final blow, the good Marik disappears from the field, and begins fighting against Yami Marik, who struggles for control over Marik's body, and refuses to be defeated. However, Marik's good half stalls Yami Marik long enough for Yugi to activate his spell card. Yugi's Ragnarok spell succeeds in destroying (and removing to the graveyard) Ra, allowing the good Marik to regain control of his body. However, a sliver of Yami Marik reappears on the field, although this time, he is the victim. Yami Marik tries to convince the good Marik to help him seize the Millennium Items and rule the world together, but fails as Marik has decided to stop being evil and make up for his actions. Marik surrenders the duel to Yugi, which sends Yami Marik to the Shadow Realm, ending the Battle City finals. Bakura and Mai are returned from the shadow realm and Marik is reunited with his siblings, who forgive him. Yugi receives the three Egyptian God Cards. Kaiba then activates the Duel Tower's self-destruct sequence, giving everybody one hour to get off the island before it explodes.

programme.desc: As Monty brings in the summer harvest, he gives advice on what to sow to keep the crops coming up to the end of Autumn. Carol Klein visits a woman who is losing her eyesight and gives her recommendations of plants that will be a feast for her senses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty propagates succulent plants, revisits his container vegetable garden, and gives advice on how to get a good crop of pumpkins. Adam looks a new garden at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex, and Rachel visits a garden of vibrant colours in Wiltshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the plants in the jewel garden reach the peak of their late summer glory, Monty starts planning for the spring when he plants ferns and gives advice on the care and maintenance of wildlife ponds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to harvest and store potatoes. He also adds late summer colour to the cottage garden and prunes shrub roses. Carol Klein travels to Norfolk to meet Adrian Bloom, a member of a horticultural dynasty.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's thoughts turn to spring when he gives recommendations for bulbs to plant that will thrive in pots. He also shows how to prune summer fruiting raspberries. In Norfolk, Frances Tophill visits a gardener who at 97 still gardens every day.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It is the autumn equinox and Monty celebrates the season's apple bounty. Monty also plans for Christmas when he plants bulbs to brighten dark winter days, and he gives advice on planting garlic for the following year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.desc: Corky tells us about his 1911 Pierce Arrow, the Honest Charley crew installs the carbuetors and filters on the Jaguar restoration, then we travel with Corky for a new acqusition for the museum.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mazda's Miata and RX-7
programme.desc: The unlikely success story of the Mazda MX-5 Miata: the world's bestselling 2-seat roadster and the only remaining true lightweight sports car.The 3rd-gen Mazda RX-7 has it all: beauty, performance, a Le Mans tie-in, and a sales failure.

programme.title: Driveway Finds | We have 24 hours to build a '71 Chevy K10 and drive it home. Swap Meet Challenge
programme.desc: Dustin and Brito attempt to build a truck at a swap meet.

programme.title: Driveway Finds
programme.desc: Dustin and Brito attempt to revive an old Pontiac Firebird.

programme.title: Driveway Finds
programme.desc: Dustin and Brito attempt to revive a 1964 Chevrolet Impala.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | BMW E36 M3 and BMW M1
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa tells you why the E36 BMW M3 is the one to have, even without a real M engine. And speaking of M cars... the back half of this episode features the amazing story of the first one, the BMW M1.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Toyota 2000GT and Nissan 240Z
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa dives into the story of Toyota's 2000GT, which was one of the fastest cars in history. Next, Jason gives us the fascinating history behind the Datsun (Nissan) 240Z.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Cleetus McFarland, Spoon Sorts, and Built By Legends
programme.desc: Larry Chen spends the day with YouTube and motorsport sensation Cleetus McFarland. Next, Larry heads to Spoon Sports to check out their heavily modified Honda Civic EG6.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Subaru BRZ and Alfa Romeo SZ
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa tells us why the new Subaru BRZ does NOT, in fact, need a turbo by comparing it to the Mazda MX-5 ND2 Miata. Next, Jason dives into the story behind one of the ugliest cars ever, the Alfa Romeo SZ

programme.title: The Appraiser | All about Ford Mustangs!
programme.desc: Colin Comer appraises a trio of interesting Ford Mustangs. A 1993 Ford SVT Cobra, 1966 Shelby GT350 Hertz edition, and a 1966 Mustang with 350,000 miles on the odometer!

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Quickest Cars
programme.desc: Lucid Air Sapphire vs. Bugatti Chiron Pur Sport vs. Tesla Model S PlaidLucid Air Dream Edition vs. Tesla Model S Plaid vs. BMW E39 M5 vs... a skydiver?Genesis GV60 vs. BMW iX xDrive50 vs. Ford Mustang Mach-E GT Performance vs. Tesla Model Y

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | The Amazing Collections of Harley Cluxton and Tom Malloy
programme.desc: Chris Jacob tours two unbelievable car collections. His first stop is with Harley Cluxton where they drive a Gullwing Mercedes and a Gulf-livery Ford GT. Next, Chris dives into some Indy 500 history with Tom Malloy and his amazing collection.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole
programme.desc: Hagerty and Henry Catchpole present the 2026 Bull Market List.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" GT Mustang, and a Honda S2000
programme.desc: Colin Comer takes a look at a rust-free Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" Ford Mustang GT, and a 2004 Honda S2000 with only 80,0000 miles.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Lamborghini Revuelto and a unique Porsche restomod
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the new Lamborghini Revuelto with its hybrid drivetrain. Next, Henry drives the REEN Concept RSGT restomod which crams a water-cooled 997 GT3 engine in a 964 body.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories of the Mk8 VW GTI and Corrado
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explains why he thinks the Volkswagen Mk7 GTI is a better overall car than the new Mk8.Next, Jason explore the gorgeous styling and impressive performance of the Volkswagen Corrado.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Tokyo Drift Reborn; Totem Automobili
programme.desc: Larry Chen heads to Tokyo to check out the vibrant car scene that has gone from underground to mainstream. Next, Larry heads to Italy where he meets Riccardo Quaggio, the CEO of Alfa Romeo restomod builder, Totem Automobili.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | BMW M4 CSL and Range Rover Sport SV Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the new BMW M4 CSL and the track-ready Range Rover Sport SV.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Underground vault at the Henry Ford, and 10 barn finds on one street
programme.desc: Tom gets a tour of the underground vault at the Henry Ford museum in Detroit, MI. Next, Tom comes across 10 interesting barn finds all on the same street.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Split-window Chevy Corvette and Jaguar E-Type
programme.desc: Part 1: Chip Foose customizes one of his dream cars: the 1963 split-window Chevy Corvette.Part 2: Chip Foose transforms the classic Jaguar E-type coupe into a streetwise sports car with even sleeker design elements.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa | All things Ford Bronco Raptor
programme.desc: In part 1 of this Ford Bronco Raptor special, host Jason Cammisa dives into the nitty gritty details of the highly capable Ford Bronco Raptor. Next, he drag races it against some very interesting competition.

programme.title: Will It Run? | Barn Find 1970 Dodge Challenger
programme.desc: Davin Reckow attempts to bring a long-parked 1970 Dodge Challenger T/A 340 Six-Pack back to life.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Ferrari Dino, AMC Javelin, Buicks and Alfas
programme.desc: With the help of a friend, Tom discovers a cache of rare and forgotten cars hidden away in Virginia. Next, Tom visits two other friends to check out their interesting collections of cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | A Jaguar E-Type story, and What To Do With a Late Friend's Car Collection?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter hears some fun stories from the longtime owner of dilapidated Jaguar E-Type. Next, Tom meets a man who was made executor of his late friend's will. Specifically, he was tasked with managing his unique car collection.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | Toyotas, BMWs, Nissans, Acuras and More!
programme.desc: This episode features THREE of Jason Cammisa's Ultimate Drag Race Replays. You'll see cars from BMW, Lexus, Toyota, VW, Hyundai and Acura.

programme.title: 50 Years of Turbo | The Porsche 911 Turbo Documentary
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa and cohosts review 50 years of Porsche 911 Turbo.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Porsche Stories: The new 911 GT3 and wild history of the 924
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa argues why the Porsche GT3 is now, unquestionably, the most important car in the 911 lineup.Next, Jason explores the wild history of the Porsche 924 and why it was never meant to be a Porsche.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | New V-12 sports cars: the Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews new Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish. Both are powered by V-12 engines with the former being naturally aspirated and the latter adding a turbocharger.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The greatest barn find collection of all time
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter meets Billy Eubanks and is unbelievable collection of cars stored in various hand-built garages and structures around his property. It is a truly amazing stash of vehicles!

programme.title: The Appraiser | 2020 Ford GT, 1976 Pontiac Trans-Am, Aston Martin DB4
programme.desc: Colin tries to put a value on a 2020 Ford GT that has one of the most desirable paint combinations and trim packages you could get in 2020. After that, Colin focuses his attention on a 1967 Pontiac Trans-Am and a 1962 Aston Martin DB4.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchple | New Shelby Cobra, Original Mazda RX-7 FD
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the BRAND NEW Shelby Cobra. Does it live up to the legend? Next, Henry does a retro review on a completely original Mazda RX-7 FD.

programme.title: 50 Years of Turbo | The Porsche 911 Turbo Documentary
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa and cohosts review 50 years of Porsche 911 Turbo.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Resurrecting rare Fords, and an incredible Shelby Cobra story
programme.desc: Tom Cotter begins this episode with a 29-year old who is "living the dream" resurrecting rare, old Fords. After that, Tom has the unique opportunity to see Herbie Hancock's Shelby Cobra that the famous musician has owned since new.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | 2025 Aston Martin Vantage and Bentley Continental GT
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole reviews latest Aston Martin Vantage, equipped with a powerful twin-turbo V-8. Next, Henry drives the Bentley Continental GT which, while losing it's legendary W-12 engine, still provides a ton of fun via a hybrid-enhanced turbo V-8.

programme.title: 50 Years of Turbo | The Porsche 911 Turbo Documentary
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa and cohosts review 50 years of Porsche 911 Turbo.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Expensive Toyotas, and the #1 GT-R Restoration Shop
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Bogotá, Colombia, to visit a world-famous Toyota Land Cruiser shop, The FJ Company. Next, Larry reveals the magic behind Garage Yoshida, the world's leading Nissan GT-R restoration shop.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Bugatti EB110 and Volkswagen XL1
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the history of the Quad-Turbo, V-12 Bugatti EB110. Next, he dives into a car most people don't know exists: the Volkswagen XL1, a car capable of 250 miles per gallon.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Fast Wagons: Audi RS4 Avant and BMW M3 Touring
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole puts the latest fast Audi Avant through its paces around town, in the hills and on the amazing Ascari race track in Southern Spain.Next, Henry jumps in another high-performance wagon, the BMW M3 Touring.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | Quickest Cars Under $35K! Plus: Demon 170 vs. Lucid Sapphire!
programme.desc: First up, Jason races the quickest cars money can buy... for under $35,0000. Next, he crowns the quickest American car EVER in a battle between the Dodge SRT Demon 170 and the Lucid Air Sapphire.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The stories behind the Ford GT and original Ford Bronco
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa tells the fascinating backstory of the 2005-2006 Ford GT.Next, Jason tells the story of the Ford Bronco, from the first generation to the current model.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Hong Kong's Underground Car Scene, and Nissan Hyper Force
programme.desc: Larry Chen checks out Hong Kong's underground car scene. Next, Larry gets the inside scoop on the newly revealed Nissan Hyper Force concept electric hyper-car.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Autozam AZ-1, Honda Beat, Suzuki Cappuccino, and Honda S500
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the history of the legendary "A-B-C" Kei Cars. To wrap things up, he dives into the story of Honda's first-ever passenger car, the S500.

programme.title: One Make: Rising Stars in the Racing World | Presented by Mobil 1
programme.desc: One Make gives an unfiltered look at what it’s like to be an up-and-coming driver in the Toyota Gazoo Racing North America GR Cup Series. This episode features Mia Lovell, Westin Workman, Lucas Weisenberg, and Henry Drury.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Datsun 240Z and Porsche 911 Restomods
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole goes for a drive in MZR Roadsports Datsun 240Z restomod followed by an outing in Workshop 5001's amazing Porsche 911 restomod.

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | Griot's Empire and Boo Boo's Garage
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs tours Griot's Garage which houses an amazing collection of vintage race cars. Next, Chris heads to Boo Boo's Garage where he finds and incredible collection of American classics.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mazda's Miata and RX-7
programme.desc: The unlikely success story of the Mazda MX-5 Miata: the world's bestselling 2-seat roadster and the only remaining true lightweight sports car.The 3rd-gen Mazda RX-7 has it all: beauty, performance, a Le Mans tie-in, and a sales failure.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mercedes' 300SL and W124 500E
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the fascinating histories behind two of Mercedes' most iconic cars.

programme.title: One Make: Rising Stars in the Racing World | Presented by Mobil 1 (1)
programme.desc: One Make gives an unfiltered look at what it’s like to be an up-and-coming driver in the Toyota Gazoo Racing North America GR Cup Series. This episode features Spike Kohlbecker & Jade Avedisian.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - '32 Ford and Volvo Amazon
programme.desc: Chip Foose sits down to draw and share his thoughts on how the 1932 Ford Model B design is still relevant today.Next, Chip tweaks the design of a lesser-known European classic: the Volvo Amazon.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Mazda MX-5 and Alpine A110 R Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the latest Mazda MX-5 and the new Alpine A110 R.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - A Cobra Killer and a Time Machine
programme.desc: Designer and hot rodder Chip Foose puts pen to paper and reimagines the oft-forgotten DeTomaso Mangusta.Next, Chip takes a crack at updating certain aspects of a DeLorean DMC-12 in an attempt to give it a more timeless appeal.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Bentley Continental GT and Lamborghini Huracán Tecnica Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the new Bentley Continental GT and the Lamborghini Huracán Tecnica

programme.title: The Appraiser | Custom 1970 Ford F100, 1988 Lamborghini LM002, 1971 Ford Bronco
programme.desc: In this episode, Colin Comer appraises a freshly built barn find 1970 Ford F100 pickup truck, an original-owner 1988 Lamborghini LM002 aka the “Rambo Lambo," and a 1971 Ford Bronco that has been used in some interesting off-road situations.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | Corvettes vs. The World
programme.desc: We drag race the first-ever hybrid, all-wheel-drive Corvette E-Ray against two Italian Supercars: the Ferrari F8 and Lamborghini Huracan Evo RWD.After that, it's the 2023 C8 Corvette Z06 against a Porsche 992 GT3, a Ducati V4 SP2, and an Audi R8.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Porsche Roadtrip and the Fastest Porsche 959 Ever?
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole drives the Tail of the Dragon in a Porsche GT4 RS before giving us a history lesson on the fastest Porsche 959 ever built.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Pontiac Fiero and Ford Taurus SHO
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa, we learn about the infamous Pontiac Fiero and the fastest, most expensive sedan Ford ever made... the Taurus SHO.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Liberty Walk Ferrari F40, Tokyo Drift IRL
programme.desc: Larry Chen heads to Japan to check out Libery Walk's "blasphemous" Ferrari F40 custom build. Next, Larry explores the not-so-secret underground car meet right after the Tokyo Auto Salon.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | 1100 HP Camaro and Corvette, Nissan's Secret to Success
programme.desc: Larry Chen meets up with Jun Hardcore to check out Rocket Bunny Racing's unique, high-horsepower classic Corvette and Camaro builds. Next, Larry discusses Nissans iconic car designs with "The KYZA" and Cody Walker, brother of Paul Walker.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat w/ Henry Catchpole - The Rocketeer MX-V6 and new Renault 5 E-Tech
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole drives the incredible Rocketeer MX-V6, a naturally aspirated, V-6 powered Mazda MX-5 Miata restomod. Next, Henry jumps in the new Renault 5 E-Tech: an affordable, fun EV for the masses?

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Millon-dollar barn find collection inherited by 3 sisters
programme.desc: Tom Cotter does what he does best: uses a barn find to learn about ANOTHER barn find! A unique LaSalle eventually leads to a $1,000,000 collection of 40 barn finds that 3 sisters just inherited from their recently passed father.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1,800 cars in remote area of California
programme.desc: Tom Cotter heads to the "middle of nowhere" in rural California where a unique collection of 1,800 classic cars is slowly returning to the earth. Next, we find Tom in the Carolinas where he discovers a 1954 Chevy Corvette and so much more.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Greg Camp heads back to Nebraska for the third year in a row hoping to put his bow tag on a giant 10 Pointer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: With human populations scattered through the landscape, human-wildlife conflict is a common occurrence in Borneo. Dan Cabela travels to the area to participate in an ambitious elephant collaring project, hoping to better understand how people and elephants can live harmoniously.

programme.title: The Journey WIthin
programme.desc: On this weeks' episode of The Journey Within - The Waterfowl Slam, Mark Peterson is in Rhode Island after a single species, the Atlantic Brant. Mark is hunting with guide and friend, Capt. Ruben Perez. Will the Atlantic Brant be an easy species to check off the list? Lone King Elder's are also known to travel though this area, is there a chance to cross this species off as well?

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.
Clay and Crystal Charlton of Take-Em Outfitters are after everything big in Alberta! Giant Lake Trout, Monster Black Bear and Big Muleys!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are smacking turkeys and making mid-term investments. 1031 Tax money is the number one way to build your land portfolio and create a place for your family to enjoy. Follow along as we turn a old beat up piece of dirt and turn it into the ultimate place ground for a hunter such as myself. From habitat to harvest we have been on fire.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike heads to the Lowcountry to rendezvous with good friend Capt. Ben Alderman.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike reunites with his South Seas comrade for a day of trout madness.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to the back, back-country where even the fish struggle to find water.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike tries to hold his own while fishing with Nick Fischer and Liza Fitzgerald in south seas Captiva. Good luck buddy.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: When crappies move to shallow cover sometimes less means more!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: We head back to the Mecca of Jumbo Perch at Lake Cascade, ID!

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny goes perch fishing with Ed Love. They are joined by a few youngsters from down south for a good ol’ fashioned fishing trip and fish fry.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny joins True North Trout and Koz as they hit the Manistee River for a bit of trout fishing on the fly.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: In the Florida Keys, legendary Capt. Paul Ross, son Capt. Pauly, and first mate Mason team up with Capt. Jared Raskob, where one Grouper drop leads to the unexpected.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: What starts as a normal trip turns wild as Capt. Jared and Capt. Garrett get swarmed by Cobia.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: The sharks won’t stop Capt. Jared and special Guest Capt. Jimmy Hendricks from having their day.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared and Capt. Jake Leon hop in the bay boat in search of a back country slam.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode, we will explore where the locals dive and experience the underwater gems where the natives love to hang out in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We will take you to some of the wrecks in the Florida Keys that locals love to dive and share their rich history and the stories held deep aboard these sunken ships. We will also take a deep dive and discuss how these wrecks are critical to the environment.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We will follow people rethinking how they can make a difference by volunteering to help the environment in the Florida Keys. Whether you are traveling to the Keys on vacation or you live there, people are making a difference by giving back.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We highlight organizations and programs making a difference in the Florida Keys. Learn how they help protect and restore these vital ecosystems.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: There is a place in Florida that not many people have heard about. The Forgotten Coast, Ever heard of it? Didn’t think so. Let’s discover it together.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: No, we aren’t talking about a hair dew. Danny hangs out with some amazing people that commercial fish for Florida gold.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself on an island in the heart of St. Joseph’s Bay on Black’s Island in search of fish, food and a good time

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: A once thriving area for wild oysters finds itself in need of rehabilitation. Danny visits a new oyster farm dedicated to building a healthy oyster population.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Maryland to bow-fish for an invasive, toothy fish called the snakehead. They learn how this fish, a native of Asia, made its way to the United States. They also learn from the locals, despite its appearance, it is one tasty fish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through South Carolina, where we stop in Clemson, Travelers Rest and Charleston!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Florida, where we stop in Jacksonville, Jupiter, Boca Raton and Miami!!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, hunting season swiftly coming to an end. Withthe real estate world getting busier, Slade and his family set outto fill some tags, and fill up the freezer. It’s time to go on a DoePatrol!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. And Slade took one down opening day. This episode features an inside look into Slade’s life filled with real eastate and the great outdoors.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Join Rush and his good friend Anthony Solmo for an epic day of fishing in the stunning waters of Key West, Florida! Leaving the Odyssea at the dock, they hop on a bay boat outfitted with a trolling motor for the ultimate inshore adventure. Gliding quietly through the shallows, they target a variety of species—including hard-pulling Tarpon and explosive topwater Jacks—leaving Rush thinking, “A guy could get used to this kind of fishing!”

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Ali’s home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma — chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and that’s exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!
Adam Hays travels to Alberta to hunt for giant bruins with Clay Charlton of Take-em Outfitters!
Chris Schmidt hunts for his largest whitetail to date during late season in Kansas!

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Blair fishes the South Texas flats using artificial lures with Capt. Luis Flandes.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: A look back at the favorites of Season 3.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team does a deep dive into a product founded by Engineered Marine Coatings called the Genius Bucket. The Genius Bucket being the ultimate DIY paint kit for those looking to tackle a marine painting job on there own. The team also checks out the capabilities it takes to restoring the older metal rub rail which derived from the Glastron project.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode, we will explore where the locals dive and experience the underwater gems where the natives love to hang out in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head offshore to the Marathon Hump, taking advantage of the 26-feet hybrid boat's versatility to find some exciting Blackfin and Skipjack Tuna fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by scientist Nick Haddad, who educates our hosts and the fishing world on the various descending devices used to preserve stressed catch from deeper waters as the three of them get into some fun Red Snapper fishing off the coast of Marathon, Florida in the Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Rich's son Reed, who takes the wheel and directs the team into some amazing early morning baby tarpon fishing in the Everglades.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Hunter Smallback into the Everglades for some snook fishing, and the action really heats up when some hungry Lemon sharks crash the party.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch two thirds of a slam when they bring Tom’s new Yellowfin 24’ Bay up to Key Largo for some exciting flats fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Mason Baker to sample some early morning Islamorada backcountry baby tarpon action.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Father/son duo Brad and Noah Rucks are after the same giant whitetail that's making regular appearances on their family farm.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: A new outfitting area added to Canadian Whitetail Outfitters and a new set of clients headed to Saskatchewan looking for their dream hunt. A summers scouting and a teams set up hopes to be enough to exceed expectations.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin heads offshore, dodges storms and shows how the "Return 'Em Right" program is saving fish that experience barotrauma.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didn’t think it was.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captain Scott Walker fishes out of Hawks Cay with fellow Duck Key resident Captain Ariel Medero catching Blackfin Tunas and big Queen Snappers.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger chase the full moon Wahoo bite fishing out of Plantation Boat Mart.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captain Scott Walker heads swordfishing out of Hawks Cay with his friend, retired WWE wrestler Travis Tomko.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Ariel Medero fish with David Moss from the Nature Conservancy out of Hawks Cay sampling the bottom fishing and deep dropping. In between the action they learn about the Nature Conservancy’s mission to promote sustainable and transparent fishing practices.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger break in Plantation Boat Mart’s new 36’ Invincible with some muttons for dinner and an epic shallow water sailfish double.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger fish with Daiwa’s Marc Mills out of Plantation Boat Mart trying out all of Daiwa’s new jigging equipment.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike navigates South Carolina’s breathtaking marsh, seizing a brief window when the seasonal high tide floods the grass, bringing incredible fishing.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike hunts For Big Snook On the East Coast.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: With a free day before Icast. Trenton and Ryan go offshore to try and fill the cooler. Catching a variety of species and hoping to get their hands on a hogfish.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton goes down North Carolina to learn the family secrets of the Forehand family. Ben Forehand is a guitarist for Christian Contemporary artist Pat Barret. When Ben isn’t playing guitar, he runs Wild and Free Outfitters getting people into the outdoors hunting and fishing, getting their minds off of the everyday grind. . Even though fishing is tough the guys build strong friendships and lasting memories.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Everyone knows Colorado for its epic mountains and fresh powder. But on this episode of DIRT, we’re digging into the unexpected side of the state (UFO rumors and all). Whether surfing infinite river waves, cultivating perfect carrot seeds, or fly fishing in downtown Denver’s shadow—geeky passions run high. Follow along as we gather ingredients for a farm to table final feast equal parts foraged, free-range, and free-thinking.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Huckberry's flagship adventure series is back in Japan and the DIRT crew is hungry as ever for adventure. This time, they’re diving into the Kansai region—where millennia-old traditions flow from the shore of Lake Biwa to surf breaks on the coast. Chef Coleman Griffin gives them a taste of the deep cultural immersion that inspires his culinary practice, from chef knives descended from samurai swords to fermented carp that went on to spawn sushi. And turns out, the perfect meal does exist, and the crew knew it as soon as they had a bite of their final omakase.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Silver Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob is joined by avid fly angler, artist & musician Paul Puckett for a day in Islamorada.

programme.title: Silver Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob participates in the 2023 Keymorada Tournament in Islamorada. This tournament, held out of the Cheeca Lodge, benefits "The Crohns & Colitis Foundation".

programme.title: Silver Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob embarks on a fishing adventure with his 6 y/o son Reid.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Lifelong cowboy and Oklahoma native Bill Parker is believed to be the 1st man to reach the shores of Normandy on D-day…June 6th 1944.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Bill Hayes was at ground zero on September 11th, 2001. Now twenty years later, Bill recalls his time serving overseas in the military as well as a New York City Firefighter.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Motorcycle junkie and Army veteran Dave Allen recounts the terrifying prospect of facing chemical warfare during Operation Desert Storm with host Jay Garstecki and special guest Paul Sr. from American Choppers.

programme.desc: Captain Scott Walker fishes out of Hawks Cay with fellow Duck Key resident Captain Ariel Medero catching Blackfin Tunas and big Queen Snappers.
